content: Been looking for old friends some luck, but not much. Can anyone give me some idea how to locate friends other then military .com.? Any help
reply: Been looking for old friends some luck, but not much. Can anyone give me some idea how to locate friends other then military .com.? Any help
title: Finding OLD BUDDIES

content: Try these: Missing Persons - military.com buddy finder and unit pages Google the units White pages on line. It might help it you told this forum units and dates. It might also make members a little more will to assist if told us a little more about yourself. Do that and stick around this forum for a while and get to know us. Wishing you success in your search. OAL God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

title: Finding OLD BUDDIES

content: The senior ncos/officers are more likely to be involved in vfw/division veterans groups so they're alot easier to find when going from nothing. May not be have been your best buddy while you were in, but as time goes by and as we get older, old grievances tend to die.
